info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SCHUYLKILL... SOUTHEASTERN NORTHUMBERLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Minersville, moving northeast at 30 mph. This storm was part of a large cluster of strong storms. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottsville, Mount Carmel, Shenandoah, Minersville, Mahanoy City, Frackville, St. Clair, Kulpmont, Ashland, Pine Grove, Tremont, Girardville, Tower City, Lavelle, Marlin, Altamont, Englewood, Forrestville, Branchdale and Seltzer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
